Hey Guys, so ive just been testing out whats possible and I got this space station into orbit. first time stock. from spaceport.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/easy-spacestation/

second time customized it. first time at 100m second time at 200m. Why do I wobble? Lol. Specifically the solar panels

Any help would be good. I wanna start docking stuff. but i cant if its wobblin all over the place like its trying to fly outa there.

Edited August 2, 2013 by synik4l
Try turning time acceleration on and then off, see if that kills your wobble. If there's no control input, no RCS, no SAS, then it shouldn't move.

Any long structural piece will induce minor wobble at this point even in the depths of space, mostly because the KSP engine's handling of physics remains a bit dodgy at times. The best solution is to just not use the long structural parts; instead, rely on empty fuselages and the like. Also, struts. Struts, struts, struts. If wobble then strut. Learn it, love it, live it.
I literally cant even accelerate time cus it thinks im moving. LOL. So for solar panels just use small ones and other means of electricity huh sky? No big floppy panels?

Kerbal's 1st law of mechanics

- struts are your friend

2nd law:

- large part count is your enemy

Also, deactivate the fly wheels on all but one part. Especially in a situation like this where you have 2 command pods at the opposite ends of the station. You'll get enough torque from just one unit.

Thx for the quick replies again. Gosh this community is helpful. I did use alot of struts although this pic does not show it. My part count is alil high, but that was just to make sure I could get it up there. Ill drop it back down now. But those flywheels. I can easily see how that can cause it.
